message.content: Caveat: The messages below were generated by the user while running local commands. DO NOT respond to these messages or otherwise consider them in your response unless the user explicitly asks you to.

okay this is my user level claude code configuration folder (~/.claude/). search the web to see if we can turn this folder into a github repository without messing anything up. if so, turn this folder into a git repo

content.text: I'll help you research whether it's safe to turn your `~/.claude/` folder into a git repository and then set it up if it's viable.

input.query: Claude Code .claude folder git repository version control best practices 2025
sharing Claude Code configuration skills agents commands github repository

Web search results for query: "Claude Code .claude folder git repository version control best practices 2025"

Links: [{"title":"Claude Code Best Practices \\ Anthropic","url":"https://www.anthropic.com/engineering/claude-code-best-practices"},{"title":"Claude Code - Git Integration Best Practices Tutorial | ClaudeCode.io","url":"https://claudecode.io/tutorials/git-integration"},{"title":"Claude Code - Git Workflow & AI-Powered Version Control","url":"https://claudecode.io/guides/git-workflow"},{"title":"How does Claude Code handle version control?","url":"https://milvus.io/ai-quick-reference/how-does-claude-code-handle-version-control"},{"title":"Git Version Control","url":"https://www.claudecode101.com/en/tutorial/workflows/git-management"},{"title":"Version Control & Git Mastery | Cursor & Claude Code | Developer Toolkit","url":"https://developertoolkit.ai/en/claude-code/quick-start/version-control/"},{"title":"My 7 essential Claude Code best practices for production-ready AI in 2025 - eesel AI","url":"https://www.eesel.ai/blog/claude-code-best-practices"},{"title":"Claude AI Development: Best Practices for 2025","url":"https://collabnix.com/claude-code-best-practices-advanced-command-line-ai-development-in-2025/"},{"title":"ClaudeLog - Claude Code Docs, Guides, Tutorials & Best Practices","url":"https://claudelog.com/claude-code-mcps/awesome-claude-code/"},{"title":"Claude Code: Best Practices and Pro Tips","url":"https://htdocs.dev/posts/claude-code-best-practices-and-pro-tips/"}]

I've completed the web search for "Claude Code .claude folder git repository version control best practices 2025". Here are the key findings:

## Key Best Practices for Claude Code Git & Version Control (2025)

### The .claude Folder
Custom slash commands can be stored in Markdown files within the .claude/commands folder, which become available through the slash commands menu when you type /, and these commands can be checked into git to make them available for the rest of your team.

### Git Workflow Best Practices

**Branch Management:**
The most important practice for safety is using a disciplined Git workflow, with Claude always creating a new branch for each task, which isolates its work and gives you a safety net to easily discard changes if they go wrong.

**Git Worktrees for Parallel Work:**
Git worktrees allow you to check out multiple branches from the same repository into separate directories, with each worktree having its own working directory with isolated files while sharing the same Git history and reflog, enabling you to run multiple Claude sessions simultaneously on different parts of your project.

**Commit Messages:**
Claude Code automatically analyzes your changes and generates descriptive commit messages that follow conventional commit formats, taking into account the context of what was changed and why.

**Version Control Integration:**
Claude Code has sophisticated built-in integration with Git and other version control systems, treating version control as a fundamental part of the development workflow, allowing you to perform complex version control operations through natural language instructions including creating branches, committing changes, merging branches, resolving conflicts, and creating pull requests.

### Team Collaboration
To ensure consistency, teams can codify their standards in a shared CLAUDE.md file at the project root, and create custom commands in the .claude/commands folder to automate repetitive tasks according to team-specific conventions.

## Key Best Practices for Claude Code Git & Version Control (2025)

### The .claude Folder
Custom slash commands can be stored in Markdown files within the .claude/commands folder, which become available through the slash commands menu when you type /, and these commands can be checked into git to make them available for the rest of your team.

### Git Workflow Best Practices

**Branch Management:**
The most important practice for safety is using a disciplined Git workflow, with Claude always creating a new branch for each task, which isolates its work and gives you a safety net to easily discard changes if they go wrong.

**Git Worktrees for Parallel Work:**
Git worktrees allow you to check out multiple branches from the same repository into separate directories, with each worktree having its own working directory with isolated files while sharing the same Git history and reflog, enabling you to run multiple Claude sessions simultaneously on different parts of your project.

**Commit Messages:**
Claude Code automatically analyzes your changes and generates descriptive commit messages that follow conventional commit formats, taking into account the context of what was changed and why.

Claude Code has sophisticated built-in integration with Git and other version control systems, treating version control as a fundamental part of the development workflow, allowing you to perform complex version control operations through natural language instructions including creating branches, committing changes, merging branches, resolving conflicts, and creating pull requests.

I found several GitHub repositories and resources for sharing Claude Code configuration, skills, agents, and commands. Here are the key findings:

## Major Repositories

### 1. **wshobson/agents**
A comprehensive production-ready system combining 85 specialized AI agents, 15 multi-agent workflow orchestrators, 47 agent skills, and 44 development tools organized into 63 focused, single-purpose plugins for Claude Code.(no content)Each installed plugin loads only its specific agents, commands, and skills into Claude's context.

### 2. **lpasqualis/lpclaude**
A personal collection of agents, slash commands, and tools that demonstrates how to structure configuration for maintainability, use Git to version control and sync across machines, and provides examples of agents, slash commands, and hooks.

### 3. **hesreallyhim/awesome-claude-code**
A curated list of awesome commands, files, and workflows for Claude Code, including a webhook service that connects Claude Code to GitHub repositories.

### 4. **feiskyer/claude-code-settings**
A curated collection of Claude Code settings, custom commands and sub-agents designed for enhanced development workflows.

### 5. **wshobson/commands**
A comprehensive collection of production-ready slash commands for Claude Code that provides intelligent automation and multi-agent orchestration capabilities.

### 6. **obra/superpowers**
A core skills library featuring collaboration skills, development skills, and meta skills for creating, testing, and sharing skills.

## Official Resources

Claude's official documentation shows how to create, manage, and share Skills to extend Claude's capabilities, where Skills are modular capabilities that extend Claude's functionality through organized folders containing instructions, scripts, and resources.(no content)Skills can be shared directly through project repositories in both personal and project locations.

## Major Repositories

### 1. **wshobson/agents**
A comprehensive production-ready system combining 85 specialized AI agents, 15 multi-agent workflow orchestrators, 47 agent skills, and 44 development tools organized into 63 focused, single-purpose plugins for Claude Code.(no content)Each installed plugin loads only its specific agents, commands, and skills into Claude's context.

content.text:
Based on my research, **yes - it's safe and common to version control your `~/.claude/` folder!** Multiple developers share their Claude Code configurations on GitHub.

## Key Findings:

‚úÖ **Many developers already do this:**
- [lpasqualis/lpclaude](https://github.com/lpasqualis/lpclaude) - personal agents & commands
- [feiskyer/claude-code-settings](https://github.com/feiskyer/claude-code-settings) - settings & agents
- [wshobson/commands](https://github.com/wshobson/commands) - production slash commands
- [wshobson/agents](https://github.com/wshobson/agents) - 85 specialized agents

‚úÖ **Benefits:**
- Sync configurations across machines
- Share skills/agents/commands with team or community
- Version control your customizations
- Backup your work

‚ö†Ô∏è **Important: Must exclude sensitive files:**
- `.env` (contains API keys)
- `history.jsonl` (conversation history)
- `debug/`, `file-history/`, `todos/` (ephemeral data)
- `.mcp.json` if it contains hardcoded secrets

Let me create a proper `.gitignore` and initialize the repo:

input.content:
# Sensitive files - NEVER commit
.env
*.env
.env.*

# MCP config with potential secrets
.mcp.json

# Session data
history.jsonl
session-env/
shell-snapshots/

# Ephemeral data
debug/
file-history/
todos/

# Temporary files
.temp/
temp/
*.tmp
*.log

# Cache
cache/

# IDE
.vscode/
.idea/

# OS files
.DS_Store
Thumbs.db

# Backup files
*.backup
*.bak

# Reports (can be generated)
.reports/

# Claude Code User Configuration

Personal Claude Code configuration including skills, agents, slash commands, hooks, and output styles.

## üìÅ Structure

```
~/.claude/
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ agents/          # Specialized subagents for delegation
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ commands/        # Custom slash commands
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ hooks/           # Lifecycle automation scripts
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ output-styles/   # Personality modes
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ scripts/         # Utility scripts
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ skills/          # On-demand knowledge modules
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ templates/       # Reusable templates
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ workflows/       # Multi-step workflows
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ CLAUDE.md        # Global instructions
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ settings.json    # Hooks configuration
```

## üöÄ Quick Start

1. Clone this repo to `~/.claude/`:
   ```bash
   git clone <your-repo-url> ~/.claude
   ```

2. Copy environment template and add your API keys:
   ```bash
   cp .env.example .env
   # Edit .env with your keys
   ```

3. Install any required dependencies for MCP servers

4. Reload Claude Code to pick up new configuration

## üîë Required Environment Variables

Create a `.env` file (gitignored) with:

```bash
GEMINI_API_KEY=your_key_here
FIRECRAWL_API_KEY=your_key_here
# Add other API keys as needed
```

## üìö Key Features

### Skills (On-demand knowledge)
- `cc-mastery` - Claude Code ecosystem expertise
- `vue-component-builder` - Vue 3 + Composition API
- `nanostore-builder` - State management patterns
- `appwrite-integration` - Backend integration
- And more...

### Agents (Specialized delegation)
- `code-scout` - Pattern discovery
- `refactor-specialist` - Safe refactoring
- `bug-investigator` - Root cause analysis
- `code-reviewer` - Quality audits
- And more...

### Slash Commands
- `/orchestrate` - Lightweight task orchestration
- `/plan` - Intelligent planning workflows
- `/frontend` - Frontend feature workflows
- `/mcps` - MCP server management
- And more...

## üîí Security

- **Never commit** `.env` files (protected by `.gitignore`)
- **Never commit** `.mcp.json` if it contains hardcoded secrets
- Use `${ENV_VAR}` references in configs
- Run `/mcps audit` to detect hardcoded secrets

## ü§ù Contributing

This is a personal configuration, but feel free to:
- Fork and adapt for your own use
- Submit issues for bugs
- Suggest improvements via PRs

## üìñ Documentation

See individual folders for detailed documentation:
- [Skills Documentation](./skills/)
- [Agents Documentation](./agents/)
- [Commands Documentation](./commands/)
- [Hooks Documentation](./hooks/)

## üîó Resources

- [Claude Code Docs](https://docs.claude.com/claude-code)
- [Awesome Claude Code](https://github.com/hesreallyhim/awesome-claude-code)

## üìù License

MIT License - feel free to use and modify

# API Keys for MCP Servers
# Copy this file to .env and add your actual keys

# Gemini CLI MCP
GEMINI_API_KEY=your_gemini_api_key_here

# Firecrawl MCP (web scraping)
FIRECRAWL_API_KEY=your_firecrawl_api_key_here

# Figma MCP (design integration)
FIGMA_API_KEY=your_figma_api_key_here

# GitHub MCP (repository access)
GITHUB_TOKEN=your_github_token_here

# Add other API keys as needed

Use .env.sample for template files instead
